title: Mike Fisher praises Carrie Underwood: 'It really is amazing how she does it all'
text:
CLOSE

Mike Fisher shares a sweet message praising his wife for being able to "do it all." (Photo: Scott Kowalchyk/CBS)

Turns out, Carrie Underwood's No. 1 fan is her husband, Mike Fisher..

While Underwood performed on stage during a stop on her tour, Fisher recorded her from the stands. He shared the video of his wife on social media, accompanied by a sweet message praising Underwood for being able to balance touring with motherhood.

"If I had a dollar every time someone on tour said 'I don’t know how she does it' I’d be rich:) I wish everyone could see how she does it," Fisher wrote.

The former hockey player gave fans a rundown of his wife's daily schedule.

Fisher described how the Grammy-winning artist gets up every morning and prepares the family's breakfast, goes to work out and then gets ready for her show, which involves everything from meeting with fans to doing press and soundcheck. Then she gets back on the tour bus, heads to another city and does it all over again.

"It really is amazing how she does it all," Fisher wrote. "Hard work is more important then talent in everything and she has loads of both but the short answer of how she does it is that God’s given her a crazy voice and determination (and energy) to be able to do what He’s called her to do!"

The couple shares two kids, Isaiah, 4, and Jacob, born in January.

He added that he loves watching the "Cry Pretty" singer get up on stage.

"I love watching her do her thing and showing people the gift that God’s given her," Fisher wrote. "He’s the only explanation to the question 'I don’t know how she does it.' "

The two celebrated more than a decade of marriage together earlier this month.

The 36-year-old country crooner commemorated their anniversary on Instagram with a touching post.

"11 years ago yesterday, I met the love of my life...patient, kind, the best dad, handsome, of course!" Underwood gushed over her husband in the post's caption. "Someone who accepts me and all my flaws...the same as me in many ways...opposite in some. But he is my match. The iron to sharpen me...."

Contributing: Erin Jensen
